definition: to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: In the end, America pulled through nicely.
sentences.chinese: 最终，美国队令人满意地涉险过关。

sentences.english: For an adventure in the jungle, consider trekking in northern Thailand. As you trek, you walk in the mountains and pass rivers and waterfalls.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想参与丛林冒险，可以考虑泰北的徒涉险之旅。

sentences.english: She narrowly won the first race.
Getting there would be worth the risks.
sentences.chinese: 而到达这种思想境界，才是真正值得以身涉险的。

definition: to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
